message: After running for what feels like forever, I finally enter a room that seems different from the others.
The tattoo! I spin around.
It pursued me relentlessly all through my flight, but now, it has vanished without a trace.
And the screen I came through is closed.
Am I safe?
I let out a sigh of relief, then take in the room.
At the center of the room is a futon. A child is lying there, face-down.
The child is wearing a kimono, but only below the waist.
In the dim light of the candles, I realize that the child's back is trembling.
...The room's red tint is from more than just candlelight.
Beneath the child, the futon is a wash of crimson.
That voice...

name: 蒼葉
message: "Koujaku?"
When I approach the futon, the tattoo that I thought was gone appears behind me.
I tense, but the tattoo slips right past my feet.
It swarms onto Koujaku's back and wraps itself around him like a black cocoon.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Koujaku!"

name: 紅雀
message: "Guh... Ughh... Ngh..."
I hear a wet sound... and then the screens at the back of the room are suddenly splattered with blood.
People are fighting on the other side of the screen. Shadows flail upon the thin paper, and I hear screams―and roars.
Again and again, sprays of blood spatter across the screens.
Are these really Koujaku's memories? What happened to him on the mainland?
While I stand there petrified, the screen slides open without a sound.
A woman peers through the opening, her face pale and wan, absent expression.
She's wearing only underclothes, and her body―is painted red from head to toe.
She staggers toward the black cocoon.
She falls to the floor, hands grasping. Her slender fingers tremble.
Did she just say... Koujaku?!

She...<K>
She's Koujaku's mother...
She's so emaciated, I didn't recognize her.

name: 紅雀
message: "Unghhhh... Nguh... Grgh..."
Inside the cocoon, Koujaku moans, as if responding to his mother's voice.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Koujaku?!"
I try to approach, but a savage pain brings me to my knees.
My back is on fire!
Sweat pours off my body. I'm shaking so hard I can hear my bones creak.
This pain...!
Is this how it felt to be tattooed?

name: 紅雀
message: "Ah, ahhh... Guh... Ugh..."
I can hear his voice.
I have to help him!

name: 蒼葉
message: "Ungh... Koujaku!"
I climb to my feet, fighting the pain.
I approach the cocoon and frantically tear at it with both hands.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Agh... Shit!"
The pieces of black tattoo scatter like charred paper. Eventually, Koujaku emerges.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Koujaku... wake up!"
I reach for his blood-smeared back.
The blood peels off his skin like jelly.
It gathers on the floor, a dark red lump that grows into the shape of a man. I recognize it.
Ryuuhou.
The blob's head melts and reforms like sugar beneath a flame, morphing into that devilish smile.
I can almost hear his voice.
His skin. His soul.
It all belongs to me.

name: 蒼葉
message: "...No. He's not yours."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Let him go!"
I drive my fist into the creature's face. It bursts, showing the room with blood.
I ignore it. Kneeling beside Koujaku, I shake him by the shoulder.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Koujaku!"
